body.p: To the Editor of the Occident!

Rev. Sir! In the April Number of the Occident
I found an article by one who adopts אמת for his name,
but it is indeed the first time, that I see "trust" controdic˶
ting itself, a fictious truth is the newest of all the
phantomes of the modern time. Permit me, Sir, to state
some words against that article. The highly learned
"truth" expounds (page 5) "The Occident cannot signify
news or light from the western states, but xc? to instruct
˶the Israelites." I suppose in my humble opinion, it is the
very problem of a jewish journal to represent the present
history of our people as much as accessible, all other articles
are a mere addition to attire the pamphlet, or a history
of hebrew literature of the day, causes and consequences of
the ruling spirit of the age. Truth will find the motto
of the Occident corrosponding with my views about Journalism,
if he merely considers, that old latin proverb: Historia
mater vivae est. History is indeed the teacher of life and
the best conductor through the career of life; History is
a second and very distinct revelation. God placed Moses
on a rock, where he should learn to know God by His
divine Attributes. Maimonides calls that rock "nature"
and I add to it ˶History" both of them reveal the God of
Israel in His Glory and Majesty. Page 5: "Truth" says: "and
˶thirdly how to conduct themselves towards their neighbors
˶which latter duty includes, according to the Talmud, the observance
˶of the whole religion" I most emphitically object against
such an atheistical statement, where, O fictious brush! where
is, Sabbath, Festivals, Milah, Shehita, Tefilin, Mesusah,
Zirith, Pidyon Bechar, Mazah and many other commands
understood under, love thy neighbor? He pleases to translate
the word of the Talmud ואהבת לרעך כמוך זו זה כלל גדול, And thou
shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, is the principal
command of the law; but every one will understand that the
ש of שבתורה could be spared, I persume, it ought
to be translated: Love thy neighbor as thyself is one of
the grand principles of our law, but there are still others

principles and germs, as: love God, be holy xc?, but they are
above the horizon of many people, as it was the case
with the Prosalite demanding of Hillel to learn him all
the Torah while standing on one foot. Does perhaps Truth suppose
we shall learn to love our God, to become fit and willingly
to love our neighbour? Now, Sir, we love our neighbour in
order to learn to love also our God, then the latter is a
higher principle than the former. Or does he suppose,
that we shall be holy in order that our manners and feelings
towards our fellow-mortal should be pure? That is the
beginning but the end of it shall be: to serve God with a
pure heart with a spotless mind. "Truth" is does not know
neither the true problem of Journalism nor the principles
of our religion. His views are clearly those of a Chabalnic
Chasid, or with english words of a jewish methodist,
as they have been masterly described by Dr. Lilienthal,
ignorance, arrogance and hypocracy mixed up with a good
portion of superstition and prejudice are the attributes of the
majority of the so called Chasidim in Polland and Russia,
but Dr. Lilienthal treated them with too much modesty, therefore
the representative of that class in America charges him
with the tendency to break down the fences of our sages.
He did not proof his arrogant presumption, not because
he would not, merely because he could not. We shall
petition the Congress at Washington, to call Truth to
the Censorship for the american jewish press, and we
will soon have a prompt Zionmächter. Next
Truth comes out with his well studied phraseology against
the advertisement of the Charleston congrigation, he is
aversed to their kind of reading the Bible, and his argument
to condemn them is, that the annual reading was already intro˶
duced by Ezra, נקרא ומתורגם is also a doctrine of Ezra כל אדם קורא לעצמו 5
is another doctrine of Ezra, who entitled us to violate these
doctrines? none under heaven, ever not Truth. He thunders
about their fasion to read the Bible, but against the organ
in the Synagogue, english prayers xc? he knows nothing
to state about. How ignorant is Truth"!

He comes out in a particular manner against the violation
of the second festivals; page 8 he says, that God commanded
You shall not add to nor diminish! Thou shalt not
turn from the word to the right or to the left! then
he gives as the reason of the second festivals של תוף מרים, that is
indeed below criticism. I will not rectify the steps of
the Charleston Congrigation, I will but show how short-
sighted "Truth" is, there are much better reasons in the
משנה for the second festival, but Truth did not know
them; there are reasons, which do not controdict the
above mentioned biblical quotation, but "Truth" knows
nothing of them. Then Truth thunders against the articles
of Talmid and H. G., supposing they should have discussed
their disagreements in their own study privatly among
themselves. These articles have been published for the purpose
to ashame all those omniscient and all-understanding
schoolars like "Truth," that they are not mindful enough
to write a single word in defence of their own religion.
"Truth" refers Talmid to the חכמי התלמוד, but, Sir, what
say the חכמי התלמוד? If you know it, you may say it, that
also the public may know it and Talmid be controdicted.
A jewish Journal publishes Clesphamans articles against
Judaism, based altogether upon one error, the Editor
published them to awaken the sleeping schoolars of the
western hemisphere, and—O pity! O tempus! O mores!
—"Truth" arose and wishes, a Journal of this enlightened
age shall fill up its columnes with discussions about
אתרוגים מורכבים about Lard Oil, shall teach the people
a better knowledge of the hebrew, Gemara and Kebalah—
?balah—did you hear it? There is the Chahatin Chasid

It is a pity to meet such dark midnights under the sun
of this all-exploring age, and I deem it proper to disclose
to the public eye how dark this midnight is; therefore
you may please to assert this in the next number
of the Occident, but if you can not, you may please
to send it back to me, for I am sure that during
a space of two months other people will address
that so called Truth. I should have signed my
name justice but I am truely your friend
